text: Non-denominational Muslims () are those Muslims who do not belong to, do not self-identify with, or cannot be readily classified under one of the identifiable Islamic schools and branches. Such Muslims do not think of themselves as belonging to a denomination but rather as "just Muslims" or "non-denominational Muslims." Muslims who do not adhere to a sect are also known as non-sectarian Muslims. Unlike Sunnis, Shias, and Ibadis, non- denominational Muslims are not affiliated with any madhhab (school of thought).Rane, Halim, Jacqui Ewart, and John Martinkus. "Islam and the Muslim World." According to a 2012 study by the Pew Research Center, Muslims who do not identify with a sect and identify as "just Muslim" make up a majority of the Muslims in eight countries: Kazakhstan (74%), Albania (65%), Kyrgyzstan (64%), Kosovo (58%), Indonesia (56%), Mali (55%), Bosnia and Herzegovina (54%), Uzbekistan (54%), and a plurality in four countries: Azerbaijan (45%), Russia (45%), Nigeria (42%), and Cameroon (40%). They are found primarily in Central Asia. Kazakhstan has the largest proportion of Muslims who do not identify with a sect, who constitute about 74% of the Muslim population. According to WorldAtlas, 30% of Moroccans are non- denominational Muslims, while two-thirds belong to the Sunni denomination. https://www.worldatlas.com/articles/religious-beliefs-in-morocco.html Southeastern Europe also has a large number of Muslims who do not identify with a sect. ==Notable individuals== Notable Muslim figures who have espoused an anti-sectarian stance include: *Al- Ma'munhttps://www.britannica.com/biography/al- Mamun#:~:text=al%2DMaʾmūn%20(born%20786%2C,subjects%20a%20rationalist%20Muslim%20creed. *Hafizhttp://www.dawn.com/news/1035023 https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=deNfpU7HUJMC&pg;=PA24&dq;=The+non- sectarian+tone+of+the+poems+of+Hafiz+struck+Debendra-+nath&hl;=en&newbks;=1&newbks;_redir=0&source;=gb_mobile_search&sa;=X&ved;=2ahUKEwi7rNPRkdSHAxVizAIHHXVWKfUQ6AF6BAgIEAM#v=onepage&q;&f;=false *Altaf Hussain Hali *Jamal al-Din al-Afghani *Kassim Ahmadhttps://books.google.co.uk/books?id=mJrEMImPkMYC&pg;=PA78&dq;=Kassim+Ahmad:+Hadiths+are+“sectarian,+anti- science,+anti-reason+and+anti- women”&hl;=en&newbks;=1&newbks;_redir=0&source;=gb_mobile_search&sa;=X&ved;=2ahUKEwjNmaW4oP2IAxW8ZkEAHcMbB2oQ6AF6BAgKEAM#v=onepage&q;&f;=falseAhmad, Kassim.
